There is a cursor on the notepad to help your writing.
 Toggle to viewing mode to move the cursor manually.(Check the button section below for details)
 Click on a piece of handwriting to move the cursor in front of it.
 Click on a line to move the cursor to that line.

There are 2 writing modes: latin and kanji.
 Toggle the writing mode in the options of the note.(Check the button section below for details)
 Set the default writing mode in settings.
 In kanji mode, each piece of handwriting will be cut into a square.
 In latin mode, the user need to refer to the auxiliary layer for better alignment.
 Note: The cursor may seems to be at the wrong place in latin mode sometimes.Don't worry, only the appearance goes wrong and the cursor can still function well. You can always set the cursor manually in this case.

There is a writing auxiliary layer when you are in the editing mode.
 Touch the screen to show it.
 Write in the top gray section to make it a superscript.
 Write in the bottom gray section to make it a subscript.
 Write anywhere to make it a normal character.
 Note: For latin mode, there is another gray section which corresponds to the middle section when you write latin alphabets (like "o" in word "good"). Write accordingly will give a better alignment.
Space button - Generates a white space on the note.
Backspace button - Delete the item before the cursor.
Toggle button - Toggle between editing mode and viewing mode. (This means under editing mode.)
Toggle button - Toggle between editing mode and viewing mode. (This means under viewing mode.)
Add Page button - Add a new page for the note. (Under viewing mode.)
Remove Page button - Remove the current page from the note. (Under viewing mode. Shown only when there are at least 2 pages in the note.)
Options button - Show the options for the note.
